column4: Like the xbox-linux project... there's a Debian side project, a Fedora side project.
It's a $100 computer. Running Linux on Xbox is so obscene it's cool.
64 megs of Ram... might be good enough for a little webserver or a Samba server.
i would think dsl would be better for xbox
when you have 2 devices on same channel it reduces speed by half
I had luck with Nvidia's drivers, but the trick is installing them using a familiar install tool like 'apt-get' or 'synaptic'.
